ethics_page.title: Code of Ethics
ethics_page.subtitle: Professional standards and ethical guidelines for Reps Egypt members
ethics_page.commitment_text1: The Reps Egypt Code of Ethics establishes the professional standards expected of all certified coaches and members. These guidelines ensure the safety, dignity, and well-being of clients while maintaining the integrity of the fitness profession.
ethics_page.commitment_text2: By maintaining certification with Reps Egypt, you agree to uphold these ethical standards and understand that violations may result in disciplinary action, including suspension or revocation of certification.

principles.title: Professional Integrity
principles.desc: Maintain the highest standards of professional conduct and honesty in all interactions with clients, colleagues, and the fitness community.
points: Practice within the scope of your certification and expertise
Provide accurate information about your qualifications and experience
Maintain professional boundaries with all clients
Avoid conflicts of interest and disclose any potential conflicts

principles.title: Client Welfare
principles.desc: Prioritize the health, safety, and well-being of clients above all other considerations.
points: Conduct thorough health screenings before beginning training
Respect medical advice and work within client limitations
Create safe and effective training programs
Recognize when to refer clients to medical professionals

principles.title: Respect and Inclusivity
principles.desc: Treat all individuals with respect and dignity, fostering an inclusive environment free from discrimination.
points: Respect diversity in age, gender, race, religion, and ability
Use inclusive language and avoid discriminatory behavior

principles.title: Professional Development
principles.desc: Commit to continuous learning and staying current with industry best practices and research.
points: Stay informed about new research and training methodologies
Share knowledge with colleagues and the fitness community

violation_minor.title: Minor Violations
violation_minor.examples: Late to sessions, Dress code violations, Unprofessional communication
violation_minor.consequences: Written warning and mandatory ethics training

violation_moderate.title: Moderate Violations
violation_moderate.examples: Practicing outside scope of certification, Inadequate supervision, Breach of confidentiality
violation_moderate.consequences: Suspension of certification for 30-90 days and remedial training

violation_severe.title: Severe Violations
violation_severe.examples: Sexual harassment, Fraudulent claims, Endangering client safety
violation_severe.consequences: Permanent revocation of certification and legal action

ethics_page.reporting_text: If you witness or experience unethical behavior by a Reps Egypt certified professional, you have a responsibility to report it. All reports are treated confidentially and investigated thoroughly.
ethics_page.footer_text: All Reps Egypt members must acknowledge and commit to upholding this Code of Ethics. Your adherence to these standards ensures the integrity and reputation of the fitness profession in Egypt.

faq_page.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq_page.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about Reps Egypt
faq_page.support_text: Our support team is here to help you with any inquiries

questions.q: How do I become an accredited coach with Reps Egypt?
questions.a: To become an accredited coach, you need to complete our certification program which includes theoretical coursework, practical assessments, and a final examination. The process typically takes 12-16 weeks depending on the program you choose. You must also meet prerequisite educational requirements and maintain professional liability insurance.
Requirements vary by level but generally include a high school diploma, valid CPR/AED certification, and completion of specific anatomy and physiology courses.

questions.q: How long is the certification valid?
questions.a: Certifications are valid for 2 years. To renew, you must complete 20 Continuing Education Units (CEUs) and pay the renewal fee.

questions.q: Can I transfer certifications from other organizations?
questions.a: Yes, we accept transfers from recognized bodies like NASM, ACE, and ISSA. You will need to submit proof of your current certification and pass a bridging exam.

questions.q: What are the benefits of membership?
questions.a: Membership includes access to our job board, discounted insurance rates, networking events, and continuing education resources.
Membership fees depend on your tier. Student membership is free, while Pro membership is 1,200 EGP/year.
Yes, you can cancel your membership at any time through your account settings. Refunds are provided on a pro-rata basis if cancelled within the first 30 days.
Yes, we offer hybrid programs with online theory modules and in-person practical workshops.

questions.q: What is the success rate of your programs?
questions.a: Our graduates have a 92% pass rate on international accreditation exams and 85% find employment within 3 months.
We offer flexible installment plans for all our major certification programs to make education accessible.

questions.q: How do I access the online learning platform?
questions.a: Once enrolled, you will receive login credentials via email. You can access the portal from the 'Login' button on our homepage.

questions.q: Who do I contact for technical issues?
questions.a: For any technical difficulties, please email support@repsegypt.com or use the contact form below.

standards_list.desc: All members must adhere to our rigorous code of ethics, ensuring client safety, respect, and professional integrity at all times.

standards_list.title: Professional Competence
standards_list.desc: Members are required to maintain their skills and knowledge through continuous professional development (CPD) and regular re-accreditation.

standards_list.title: Client Safety & Welfare
standards_list.desc: The physical and mental well-being of training clients is paramount. Strict guidelines are in place for risk assessment and injury prevention.
